title: Income, Employment and Financial Markets
ziele: The course aims to provide an introduction to key topics in the field of macroeconomics.
lehrinhalte:
Introduction
Macroeconomic variables
Producing income
Managing financial wealth
Interdependence of goods and financial markets
Foreign economic relations and domestic income
Unemployment and real wage formation
The emergence of inflation
The development of growth, unemployment and inflation rate
beurteilung:
Two written tests (multiple choice), one of which is optional (the better result counts)
Bonus points for well-formulated, perceptive oral contributions in class
sonstiges: The course is tutor-supported and can be selected as an "intensification course"
voraussetzungen: <sup><acronym title='Unfortunately this information is not available in english.'>(*)</acronym></sup>keine
methoden: The lecture is based on a textbook and complemented by some additional contents.
literatur: Blanchard, Olivier / Amighini, Alessia / Giavazzi, Francesco (2010), Macroeconomics – A European Perspective. Harlow (UK) etc.: Prentice Hall Pearson Education)
